snippet: In the 50 years since his assassination, the image of John F. Kennedy has shifted from tragic hero to flawed leader.
abstract: Examination of American textbooks shows that in the 50 years since his assassination, image of President John F Kennedy has shifted from charismatic and tragic hero to flawed leader whose oratory outstripped his accomplishments; newer works have emphasized Kennedy's legislative setbacks, his deepening commitment to Vietnam and his lack of vigor in pursuing civil rights.
lead_paragraph: In the 50 years since his assassination, the image of John F. Kennedy has shifted from tragic hero to flawed leader.

headline.main: Textbooks Reassess Kennedy, Putting Camelot Under Siege
headline.print_headline: Textbooks Reassess Kennedy, Putting Camelot Under Siege
